questions.text: The opening scene of the episode is a flashback. In what year is it set?
questions.explanation:
1881.

	The scene flashes back to a small shack with a young girl laying down clutching her doll. A man and a woman walk into the room and share a moment. The man turns to leave and the woman tells him to come back to them. This scene is the introduction of The Saint of Killers, a character from the comic book.

questions.text: What was Jesse doing when we first saw him in this episode?
options: Staking out a potential victim to kill
questions.explanation:
Baptizing people.

	He baptized several people from his parish and his ex-girlfriend, Tulip. She was only there to attempt to draw him back into his former life as a criminal. He refused to help her and she left.

questions.text: What was missing out of the church supply closet?
questions.explanation:
Communion wine.

	The woman who helped to run the church implied that Cassidy (the vampire) had stolen it and asked Jesse to talk to him about it. Cassidy was hanging out at the church after being released from jail following the bar fight in the previous episode.

questions.text: What was stolen out of the Preacher's truck while he was in town?
options: A list of parishioners home addresses
questions.explanation:
His steering wheel.

	"What happened Preacher? Jesus take your wheel", was the quote when Tulip pulled up next to him. She then pulled away claiming to be a changed woman since her baptism.

questions.text: How old did Cassidy claim to be?
questions.explanation:
119 years old.

	He told Jesse that he was a vampire while they were sitting in the church midway through the episode. At the time Jesse didn't believe him. By episode's end Cassidy had shown him that he was in fact a vampire. He also told Jesse that he was left handed and thought "The Big Lebowski" was overrated.

questions.text: DeBlanc and Fiore tried to kill Jesse. How were they planning to off him?
questions.correct: Cut him to pieces with a chainsaw
options: They planned to poison him and leave him to die
Shoot him in the town square with everyone watching
questions.explanation:
Cut him to pieces with a chainsaw.

	The duo found Jesse passed out in the church after he drank from Cassidy's flask. Cassidy returned just in time to save Jesse from their chainsaw. Jesse slept through the entire ordeal.

questions.text: What city is the show set in?
options: It hasn't been revealed yet in this episode
questions.explanation:
Annville.

	While the name of the town was stated in either the pilot or the second episode, you can see the name on several of the businesses when the setting is in town. The most prominent of the signs in town if for Annville High School, home of the prairie dogs.

questions.text: Which character was shot in the stomach, yet remained unphased by it?
questions.explanation:
Cassidy.

	While saving Jesse from his two assailants Cassidy was shot in the stomach. He fell over, but only to trick one of the men into checking on him. He then attacked both men. During the fight he cut off the arm of one of the men who was holding a chainsaw, and the chainsaw continued to inch toward Jesse.

questions.text: Where did Jesse take a casserole dish?
questions.explanation:
To a parishioner's family.

	He was trying to be a good preacher and took the casserole with him on a home visit to a young girl who had been injured in a serious accident. The woman promised to feed the casserole to her dogs. The woman was very bitter over the  injuries her daughter faced.

questions.text: Jesse was kidnapped and shot near the end of the episode.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It was set up to look like a kidnapping to the viewer for a few seconds, however it was quickly revealed that his "captor" was Tulip. Jesse realised it quickly and ruined her attempt at "role playing" as she put it.
